Reviews.Title: Would You Look at That!
Reviews.Author: Nickolas X. P. Sharps "Fleet Strike 13"
Reviews.Content: Alright so I've never done a review on anything this technological or expensive before so be warned. Since this is such a high end product I figure it deserves an extensive review so I will be updating this as time goes on.Installation: WHOA. You really don't realize how large a 46 inch television is until you have to lift it up, flip it around, and attach the base to the bottom. I guess you probably have to do this with most televisions of this nature? Anyway I will say that the Seiki is relatively light for something so large. Light and THIN. Holy Cow is it thin! So the installation of the base is sort of a pain but it goes quickly enough. The base itself is flimsy plastic. I am concerned about the stability of the television. It hasn't rocked or wobbled or anything yet but if someone knocks into the television by accident I don't have the greatest faith in its ability not to fall over and ruin my day. The screws that connect the base to the Seiki are also pretty flimsy. I'm considering purchasing a wall mount. It seems like a safer alternative. Attaching the base will take five minutes top and then you have to find somewhere to place your SUPER LARGE TV!Set-Up: I am not a tech-minded person. I live in the wrong era. Setting up the Seiki could have been a nightmare for me. It was not. The process was quick and easy, it probably took another two minutes and then TADA! You're ready to enjoy your SUPER LARGE TV!Enjoying Your SUPER LARGE TV: I love the picture on the Seiki. I love the colors. We watched Joss Whedon's The Avengers on this beast and it was the next best thing from seeing it in theaters. We have also played lots and lots and lots of Borderlands 2 on the X-Box 360 and it is epic. We do split screen co-op multiplayer and despite the fact that the screen is split in half, on the Seiki it doesn't hinder the quality. I find this particularly awesome.So far things are going great. I really love this TV. Complaints are minimal (until someone knocks this thing over and shatters my hopes and dreams all over the floor) and the picture quality is great. The Seiki is thin and (relatively) light. Installation and set-up is easy as cake (good for we who are less than technologically adept). I will warn you that I have seen complaints regarding the retail/home mode on not just this Seiki but others. I have yet to have any such problems but again, I'll update this as I get a better feel for it.***UPDATE***I've decided to update the TV to 5 stars (from 4). The only reason I hadn't given the Seiki a perfect score to begin with was the volume but I've informed this can be remedied with some external speakers. Again, I'm not a tech-minded person and this was my first HDTV so sorry about that. The Seiki has been a great TV from the start. I haven't had any troubles with it and it was especially appreciated during this last hockey season.

Reviews.Title: Seiki LED TV
Reviews.Author: Thomas P. Troyer
Reviews.Content: I have had the Seiki 46" LED TV for about two weeks and it is a bedroom TV with no externals added such as DVD player, etc. The picture is very clear and bright. The sound is somewhat better than most flat screen TV's but not what you would find with a sound system or even the old big box TV's with the larger speakers.  I will start with set up: it was easy to unpack the TV and attach the stand. I haven't bought many big TV's and perhaps they all come packed the way the Seiki was packed. When I removed the straps around the box, the whole box lifted up over the TV, very nice. The set-up guide was very easy to use and worked without a hitch. It was easy to get both the over air stations and to get the Satellite dish hooked up.  The set does have three HDMI ports, a PC audio and VGA port for hooking up to a PC, a RF and a Coaxial port for aerial or audio receiver. It also has the usual ports for game consoles, etc. Since I am not using anything except for the one HDMI for the dish and an aerial port for the over air stations, I cannot review any other hookups.  The set has the usual settings in the menu for adjusting the video, audio, child proofing, etc. The remote is easy to use and functions in a natural way, though I programed the dish remote so I only have to use the one remote for both. The only comparisons that I can make with other TVs is between another 46" Sharp TV which is about 6 years old and the old Toshiba "big box" TV that this replaces. The Seiki is clearer than the Sharp and has better everything than the old Toshiba. The sound is almost as good as the Toshiba it replaces. The LED picture seems clear, bright and has a very good range of color and contrast. Blacks are black. Viewing from the side angles seems very good though this will be viewed straight away for me.  The one thing that would be a negative for me if I used it in the living room is that it has the shiny, reflective screen like the plasma TVs. Since I use it in the bedroom primarily at night, this is not an issue. My living room is very bright with windows opposite the TV so my best option there is the LCD rather than this LED.  Overall I couldn't be happier with this TV unless it somehow got great sound out of little speakers. I expected the sound quality to be less than a good sound system and that is what I got. With the very reasonable price of the Seiki on Amazon, I can afford a sound bar if I wish.  I strongly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: 5 Star Quality - No less
Reviews.Author: Gamer
Reviews.Content: First of all I want to say that anyone who rated this product less than 5 stars did so due to their own incompetence of technology.SCREEN:I can honestly say that this screen has the best color, clarity, contrast, and resolution that I have ever seen. I'm sure there are better screens out there, but for this price, it is completely Amazing. I couldn't take my eyes off of it when I put on the first 1080p HD video for a test run.SPEAKERS:I can't believe how many people had the outrageous expectation that a (2" thick) LED TV would somehow (magically?) sound like a Dolby 7.1 surround sound. I will not ever use the speakers built into this TV, and I never had the intention to. Actually, I'd rather they remove the speakers completely just to save a bit of money.Anyone looking for an LED TV should immediately understand that a 2" thick TV will not have good speakers. You Must have a surround sound system that you intend to use with it. This is completely obvious and Not a reason to hinder the rating of the product.QUALITY:The TV was in perfect condition when delivered, and there were no issues hooking it up. It was a very simple plug-and-play. The casing itself is a quality plastic, and there is sheet of glass protecting the screen. The stand that it comes with does require you to put some screws into plastic, but if you are smart about it and you don't crank them in like a lug nut on a semi truck, the stand works very well and holds the (rather lightweight) TV with ease.Bottom line: The Best TV under $400. You will love this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Seiki 46" LED Slim TV
Reviews.Author: Pwny Troller
Reviews.Content: Bought on Black Friday @ 349.00. Awesome deal in my opinion. Arrived in 2 days too! The colors are deep and look awesome coming from my 42" LCD. Very happy with this purchase. Also these supposably have Samsung screens built in them. Dont know if thats true or not but this TV deffinatly has an awesome picture. Save some money and buy this over a name brand. You will be 100% satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Great picture easy setup
Reviews.Author: Oaker
Reviews.Content: Received the Seiki 46 inch tv in record time, set up was a breeze, connected to DirecTV and bam, what a picture, sports, shows and news, all extremely clear no fuzz around the edges, great tv at an incredible price. The only problem was DirecTV does not list the Seiki brand for TV when setting up the remote. Not Seiki problem, so 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Seiki SE461TS LED TV
Reviews.Author: Skyeye
Reviews.Content: I am completely satisfied with this television set!It has all the features I need and more.Very thin and light weight.The picture quality is as good or better than most major brands.  They use a Samsung screen on this unit.Compatible with streaming video computers and most other components. It appears that you can connect anything to this TV!

Reviews.Title: Happy with the TV so far
Reviews.Author: N.T.
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV for $399 when it was on sale. We can't be happier with the purchase so far. The picture is crisp, the sound quality is pretty good. It took me less than 5 minutes to set it up, and we have no issue with it whatsoever. It's probably the best TV you can find for $400. Let's see how long the TV lasts.

Reviews.Title: Codes for Seiki
Reviews.Author: sightsandsounds
Reviews.Content: THANKS TO,,,B. Diaz says:These are the codes off of the Seiki site.DIRECTV - 10178Time Warner Cable - 0178Philips - 0002Comcast - 11864 or 10178Cox Communications - 0178Atlas DVR Device URC - 0178Bell Remotes & Dish Network - 505, 506, 516, 523, 526, 566, 573, 612, 627, 647, 652, 653, 654, 655, 656, 658, 659, 664, 665, 667, 669, 670, 679, 680, 704, 717, 730, 738These were posted inside a commenters inside comments, not visible for most,, Thanks B. DiazThanks to Amazon for posting this.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good TV
Reviews.Author: R. Budny
Reviews.Content: Before I purchased the Seiki, I read through a majority of the reviews both pro and con.  I was a little hesitant to go through with the purchase, especially when this is a brand I am not familiar with.  Well, so far, so good!  The TV was easy to unpack and putting the stand on was easy also.  Set-up was quick and I didn't have any problems.  I've had it set up for three days, I wanted to make sure everything ran well before I wrote a review.  So far I am happy.  The picture is sharp and the colors rich in HD.  The one minus in my opinion is that the sound is kind of tinny but I had a sound system already and once I hooked that up it's all good. That's the reason for four stars.  All in all, for the price this is a pretty good tv.  I would suggest it to anyone who doesn't have a lot of money to spend and doesn't mind not having all the bells and whistles.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Billy Madison
Reviews.Content: Overall a *fairly decent TV, especially for the black Friday price of $350. However,the cheap price comes with a cost.*Picture quality during HD playback seems quite good. Like most other LED televisions, picture and settings will need to be adjusted to get the most out of the experience. I found the "movie" picture preset to be a good starting point.*Bright scenes tend to be colorful and vibrant. No complaints.*TV does not do well with SD cable, although this is normal for many LED/LCD HDTVs.*Sound is sub-par at best, but can be remedied via external sound systems.**The biggest issue with this set in my opinion is back light bleed (especially in corners). I returned the first set as I deemed the extent of the bleed to be unacceptable. During normal viewing the experience is often ruined by the pervasiveness of light bleeding through into the picture, destroying the atmosphere and mood of dimly lit and dark scenes. Once you see it, it cannot be unseen. You will find your eyes being pulled away from the picture to focus on what appears to be the soft glow of little street lamps extending out in a fan pattern from the corners of the television set. The replacement I received had similar issues, though just slightly less extensive than the first. Other reviewers have pointed this out as well, and unfortunately this seems to be the norm with this set.The response from Seiki Tech Support regarding this issue:you can not compare lcd with led.  led is the backlight. you will have bleed through. lcd does not have led lights. just has one long light bulb. example. lcd: one long blun at top and shoots light all the way down. led: 10000 led lights that fill the screen  so there is no compares-en . this is why you can tell. there is nothing that can be done.--  JerryTech SupportIn closing,this TV gets the job done at a cheap price. It's thin, light, has and has the potential for good quality HD playback with a little tweaking. It shines during bright, colorful scenes, but disappoints during dark moody scenes due to back light bleed issues. Be aware of the pros and cons prior to purchase.

Reviews.Title: Can't go wrong for the price!
Reviews.Author: Uncle Meph
Reviews.Content: I've had a Samsung 46" DLP for the last 5 years, and it died a month ago.  Short on cash, needed something to replace it, and found this for $350.00 -  it arrived yesterday.  Read a bunch of reviews about having to upgrade software, change settings, etc.  I took it out of the box, connected the base, plugged it in, plugged the HDMI cable from the satellite box and HD-DVD in, and it works just fine.  Picture is fine.  I'll reserve final judgement until the Michigan-Ohio State game later on today, but how can you go wrong for the price?  Would have cost more than that just to have someone come out and look at the Samsung.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING TV
Reviews.Author: Nikolaz Salinas
Reviews.Content: the headline says it all, I am very happy with it the picture quality is amazing and it fits right in my dorm. Have nothing but good things to say about this product.

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny and then some
Reviews.Author: Jenny Garnsey
Reviews.Content: We ordered this T.V. and received free 1 day shipping. The tv came undamaged, and well packaged.As stated the stand was not attached, however was easily installed with a few screws and feels sturdy.Powered up very quickly, and setup was very quick and painless. (note that Dish Network DOES have this tv under their remote setup, and can be programmed) The screen is Extremely bright and well pixelated without any missing pixels or bluriness. We didn't have to adjust anything whatsoever and picture was perfect.  (TV does NOT come with anHDMI cable so you might want to order one). I will say that out of everything the sound was very disappointing. Muffled voices, and lousy volume control via the tv itself. Still worth quite a bit more than we paid. So I  would highly recommend a seperate sound source. You can find very nice soundbars or Logitech systems has a fairly inexpensive home theatre surround system. This system gets a 4/5 in my eyes every day and is only missing that extra star for the sound.

Reviews.Title: Expectations are everything!
Reviews.Author: movie mike
Reviews.Content: Most people don't expect to drive a Benz on a Yugo budget, so I'm pretty sure the majority of folks buying this TV aren't anticipating the overall quality of, say, a higher-end Samsung. If you stop and think about the fact that you can get this 46" LED HDTV for something around $350- which is about what a friend of mine paid for a 19" RCA tube 30 years ago- you probably should thank your lucky stars if the thing even powers on, let alone displays an actual picture. But the 46" Seiki achieves both, and even goes a bit farther.  Here are a few observations:1) Vivid colors, but be prepared to tweak the factory settings for brightness, contrast etc. My picture was crummy out of the box, and I was pleasantly surprised at the improvement after spending 1/2 hour on adjustments. Still have a bit more to do.2) Definite LED backlight bleed in the corners with dark scenes- expect it, deal with it, or spend more $$.3) Have some HD material on hand for your test drive- this set, like many HDTVs, does not do particularly well with SD (are you listening, Netflix?).4) Sports look just ok, not great, but part of that may be the artifact associated with internet streaming rather than actual motion blurring.5) Viewing angles are excellent (although why anyone would want to watch outside of 45 degrees is "beyond" me.)6) If you're using this with a pc and hdmi cable- hopefully your video card allows you to adjust the scaling (overscan/underscan), otherwise part of the image may be cut off. It took me awhile to make this adjustment in Catalyst Control Center because the necessary HD resolution wasn't initially listed, but I got it done. Otherwise this would have been a deal breaker since the TV is hooked up only to my computer.7) PC text is acceptable, but not as crisp as on a larger Sharp Aquos, even after adjusting Clear Type several times.8) If you're mounting on a wall- inexplicably the set is built such that the power cord interfered with placement of my VESA 400 x 400 mounting bracket. I had to use spacers to clear the cord, so the TV is about 3/4" farther from the wall than it needs to be.9) I have no idea what the speakers sound like and never intend to find out.10) The remote is very basic and I like it that way.So is this really a 4 star HDTV? No, without taking price into account it's a 3 star tv, but considering the cost it earns every bit of 4 stars.  If you're looking for a set for your living room (or main viewing area) and have some extra cash laying around then I'd definitely buy something better. But if cash is tight then go ahead and put the Seiki front and center. Sure, at first your friends might smirk a bit, but hit them with the "in-the-door" numbers and watch that smirk morph into a "what an idiot I was for spending 3-5 times as much on a brand name" look of total chagrin!

Reviews.Title: Great TV with small drawbacks
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: This was my first 1080 TV and first TV larger than a 32 inch. I was very hesitant to buy what I considered to be an off-brand TV but have been very pleased with my purchase. I haven't noticed the 60hz refresh being a problem at all, I honestly can't tell the difference between 60hz and 120hz. The color needs to be calibrated but such will be the case with any new TV. Altogether the picture is gorgeous and huge.The sound quality isn't spectacular but if you want spectacular sound you probably shouldn't use built-in speakers on any TV.The one drawback I'm frustrated with is in the settings--there's no way to turn off overscan on HDMI inputs. What this means is if you plug your computer in to the TV through HDMI the image will fall off the screen on all sides, losing about 5% of your image. The only way to correct for this is apparently manually resizing the output on your video card and losing 1920x1080 pixel-to-pixel matching. According to the internet, apparently major brands like Samsung have an auto-detection mode that corrects for this. Seiki does not, and Seiki customer service has not returned my e-mails requesting a solution.Picture: Great. Sound: OK. Settings: Lacking. Don't get this one if you plan to use it frequently hooked up to a computer input.Edit: Attempted to work with Seiki customer and tech support, they were immensely UNHELPFUL. Solved overscan issue myself by using VGA cable instead of HDMI for PC input. Happy with the TV, disappointed in Seiki.

Reviews.Title: Set up was ok wasn't sure if this TV could lay down
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Set up was a little hassle but nothing to complain about other then that this was Worth the money!!!! Nothing but smiles here ignore the other bad reviews they don't know a good product when they see it would defently recommend this to a friend or family member!!!

Reviews.Title: Pretty good but....
Reviews.Author: zo0d
Reviews.Content: Movies/TV: Watching movies and shows look great on this TV, there's no doubt about that. Colors are better than okay.Sound: It's a little tinny when you turn up the volume, but otherwise its alright. You really can't expect a booming sound system considering how thin the TV is.Gaming: This what I had initially bought the TV for. Much to my disappointment, I can't seem to get the colors just right. I'm using Forza Motorsport 4 as a basis for this review. I'm having a real hard time adjusting the colors to match what the cars should look like. It seems as if the TV is having a hard time with the Blues in the game. or example, cars like the E46 BMW M3 with its distinctive Laguna Seca Blue paint, isn't displayed correctly at all. The Chevrolet ZR1 with its light blue paint suffers from this too. I'm sure a host of others cars have the same predicament. I have tried adjusting the TV settings. Right now i'm at Contrast 65, Brightness 50, Color 60, sharpness 60, color temp. cool.Overall for $350 with 1 day shipping, I really can't complain.If anyone would like to share their calibrated settings with me, I'd appreciate it.Edit: The problem persist to all my games. I just may return this, it's almost unbearable. I'm realllly trying to like it too.

Reviews.Title: Update - failure and awful warranty on a previously mediocre TV
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: !!!Update!!! This TV failed about 6 months after purchase.  The HDMI ports suddenly stopped working and would not transmit any picture, yet the VGA cable still would show a picture.  I contacted Square Trade about redeeming my warranty and they told me to first contact Seiki.  After 3 or so ingnored e-mails, I got through by phone and a Seiki representative told me to send it back to them and they would send another, except that I must pay for the shipping back to them.  The rep told me it wouldn't be much - about 50.00.  I checked with Fedex, UPS, and USPS and the cheapest price I can get is about 150.00.  It is crazy to pay this much for another TV made with Seiki's poor quality.  And what, pay another 150.00 in six months for another poorly made TV?  Square Trade gave me my purchase back when they heard how awful Seiki's warranty is.  They said they didn't want the TV and I could do with it what I chose.  I got a new circuit board online for about $72.00, the board that holds the HDMI ports, and installed it in the defective TV.  I figured since I got my money back, I would take a 72.00 chance on it only lasting 6 months, or maybe still not working at all.  But it's been over a month now and it's been working fine with the new circuit board.  I've learned a valuable lesson, though.-Seiki is a company that punishes the consumer for trusting their product and a company from which I will never buy another TV.  I would also guess that Seiki often makes a product that fails to meet people's expectations.  Why else would they discourage people from returning defective products?-Square Trade is an awesome company that I will definitely do business with again.-Cheap TVs are a risk that may or may not turn out to be worth it.  I'm going to spend more on a name brand with a better warranty policy for my future TV purchases because it just isn't worth the hassle.Original Post:I ordered this on 11-26-12 for $348.00.  I'd been price-watching since Black Friday and it seemed like the price was the lowest it was going to be.  I wanted this TV mainly for playing PS3 on and watching movies and TV shows on my thumb drive in the PS3.  I had bought another 26" Seiki LED HDTV about a year previous and have been delighted with it - touch screen buttons on the TV and a great picture for about $140.00.  I thought it was a great deal then and I still do.  It's a really great TV with now flaws I've ever noticed.  So I expected great things from this Seiki.The first TV arrived destroyed during shipping.  UPS was to blame.  I could see that something heavy had sat on the box and punched through it, cracking the screen and popping the frame around the TV apart.  However, Amazon was great.  I printed out the return slip, took it to the UPS store and sent if off, and my new TV was on the way to me before I had even finished doing this.  This is why I love Amazon!  About 5 days later my new TV arrived, intact.The new TV was different from the old TV, at least as far as the base.  The base of the first TV was plastic, but had metal strips reinforcing it underneath.  The new one look the same, minus the metal strips.  Immediately I could see it wasn't as strong.  After putting it together, I could see that the TV was crooked.  The right corner of the TV was lower than the left about about an inch.  That's pretty crooked in my book.  I spent about an hour making little cardboard and paper shims to put between the base and the TV before screwing in the screws tight.  It took some trial-and-error to get it leveled.  I just wish I could have kept the old base.  Finally I got it so that the TV is straight and nobody from the front can see my modifications.  It's stable and I have no worries about it falling down or collapsing when bumped.  I move it around all the time to plug in PC HDMI plugs and it's fine.  It was just a pain to get it leveled.After fixing the base problem, I encountered another, more obnoxious problem.  The audio output is only coaxial and red/white stereo output.  My other Seiki had a 3.5mm headphone plug.  So I pulled out an adapter I had and hooked up the red/white stereo plugs to my computer speakers.  Much to my irritation, the sound worked fine, but the TV volume on the remote had no effect on the stereo output.  Turn up the volume on the remote and nothing happened on the stereo speakers, but the TV volume went up through it's much-discussed crappy speakers.  So I had to go out and buy speakers that had their own remote.  Now I have to keep the TV volume at zero and I have 3 remotes - one for the TV and one for the speakers, and one for my PS3.  Irritating that the TV wouldn't know when something was plugged into it and transfer all audio properties over to the external source.  I have not tried updating the firmware, so perhaps it could be fixed with that?  I sort of doubt it, but who knows?  I know my old Seiki was smarter than this right out of the box.The third problem is rather minor in my opinion.  On a black screen or dark scenes during a movie, there is minor white light bleed coming from the corners and 2-4 blotches and tracks in the middle of the screen, depending on the day.  I sounds bad, but it's really quite minor.  I have to point it out to guests who seem rather disinterested and either don't see it themselves or don't notice it as much as I do.  It's really not that bad, but I notice it when I'm looking for it.Other than these 3 problems, the TV is awesome.  Great picture in my opinion.  Bright, crisp, big, awesome.  Hasn't let me down in the past month, though I did by a 3 year warranty in case it does.  I'd buy this TV again in a heartbeat for what I paid for it.  For what it's going for now ($520.00), I'd never do it.  Some things are worth messing with and putting up with when you get a good deal.  For $520.00, though, I think you could do a lot better. Another name-brand TV for $500.00 might be a bit smaller, but you wouldn't have to buy new speakers, put pieces of paper in the stand, and notice vague white blotches in the dark scenes.  It's good, but not $520.00 good.  It's $350.00 great.

Reviews.Title: BUY IT!!!!
Reviews.Author: RjBass
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV on Black Friday when it was on sale for $349.99.  I got the free super saver shipping with it and was told it would take 5 to 7 business days to arrive.  Well it's Tuesday, only 4 full days since ordered and it is already hanging on my wall.  I can't believe this TV cost so little.  With it's Samsung screen and elegant black finish, this unit could easily sell for $600 plus if it weren't for the unknown brand name.  This TV looks amazing.  Fantastic color reproduction, everything works including the coax digital audio out which was a must for my system.  I have my Dish HD box, Blu-Ray, and Media Center PC all plugged into it via HDMI and it all just works.  Setup was a breeze.  It even came with mounting screws for wall mounting so putting it in place of my old tv was super easy.  No need to go to the hardware store to find the correct size screws.  As long as this thing holds out, I will say it was the best $349.99 I have spent in the last 10 years.Buyer be warned though.  Seiki is an unknown brand, and while it does have a Samsung screen, you have to wonder what parts they cheeped out on to get the price so low.  When ever you purchase a big box item like this from an unknown brand, get the extended warranty with it.  With the Black Friday discount, I got the TV and the 4 year warranty and still paid less than $400 for it all.My one complaint about this TV is not actually about Amazon or Seiki, it is actually about FedEx.  They dropped of the TV on my front porch in plain site of all traffic and pedestrians on my street with no signature.  I don't know how many hours it was sitting there before I got home from work, I just feel damn lucky it was actually still there.  It is very obvious what it is as the box is clearly labeled. So be sure to have somebody at home to receive it 2 to three business days after you order, or else somebody else could be enjoying your brand new purchase.

Reviews.Title: Review from a Non-Tech Kinda Girl :)
Reviews.Author: Penny Pinching Polly "Check out my website fo...
Reviews.Content: When I'm shopping for a TV, I want to know a few important details. That's what I'll cover in this review.Installation/Set-Up:  I was able to set this up by myself, painlessly.  It was pretty simple, and for that I am thankful.  :)Picture Quality: The photo quality is surprisingly good! I am an owner of a 52" Samsung TV and I have high expectations due to being spoiled by my Samsung.  I have to admit, this Seiki has a really great picture.Good Deal for Price?:  YES!  You will not find a better TV at this price point.

Reviews.Title: Absoloutely the best!
Reviews.Author: lmttom
Reviews.Content: Just received the tv from Fedx. It is absolutley beautiful. The tv itself, is fully black with a shiny black screen, almost represtative of a plasma. I mention black, because the pictures here indicate grey.  I had it professionally installed on the wall, higher than average height in relation to a sitting plateau. Due to elevation of the tv, the speakers are located on the bottom of the tv, wihin the bezel. This is important because the volume of the tv, believe it or not, can be loud. Volume to me regarding this tv, is no problem; actually, I have it on a very low volume while watching standard cable. (It is able to go quite loud, otherwise.)  The true LED design is extremely thin, and the colors are astounding!  I can't believe something of this quality can be offered so inexpensively.  Definately recommend my highest rating!!

Reviews.Title: Mysterious resets
Reviews.Author: Terry Nassoiy
Reviews.Content: This TV resets itself every few months.It will freeze and power off and then when turned on again it will behave like it is new and require a rescan of the channels and any other settings.  I have had it for over a year and could not link the resetting to hot or cold days. I do know that if I use the 'favorites' and store channels in there it will mess itself up and I will lose all of the lower channels. That will require another rescan to get them back.It is a great large monitor for Blu-Ray watching. the LED bleed is only noticeable on very dark movies. Yes the speakers are weak. A connection to the stereo is needed for movie night anyway.

Reviews.Title: GARBAGE TV and Company
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: I owned this TV for under a year and it already started dying on me.  Tried to return since its under warranty but they want me to pay for shipping it back.....and that runs around $100.If you have any questions on this company..just read the complaints to the BBB and a few other websites.  STAY AWAY from these guys!!

Reviews.Title: Best "Cyber-Monday" purchase - 2012
Reviews.Author: PaulH
Reviews.Content: This TV was a great purchase, even more at cost shipped ($349) on Prime. I've used this unit for over 1 yearHas plenty of HDMI, composite inputs for most people. Sound quality is OK, particularly when you see how slim this unit is. The audio improved considerably when I mounted it on the wall. Not overly impressed by the remote that comes with the tv - channel and volume buttons are small and backwards from most other remotes. I did get used to it, but have a Harmony remote now that works a little better for me.Pros:  Great price, super picture quality, very slim design, inputsCons: Sound Quality, remote

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Sarah Gillham
Reviews.Content: Picture is Great but the sound isn't the best. Its not noticeable unless I go back and forth between my LG which has much crisper sound. Gets the job done. I enjoy watching football on it!Edit:  I have owned it for a little over a year and it survived a move across the country and it's still working!

Reviews.Title: Decent tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: Good picture quality. Sound sucks, I mute the sound and use a sound bar hooked to the cable box though so not a problem. Very nice tv for the price.

Reviews.Title: A real bargain
Reviews.Author: tinyfistsoffury
Reviews.Content: I've had the TV for a few months now. It works like a charm and the picture is ok. There is some light leakage, but overall it was a steal and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy for the Price
Reviews.Author: Karen McGowan
Reviews.Content: The color and picture are great. My only complaint is that the sound seems off. I've played with the settings and think it sounds okay now. For the price I paid it was a good deal. I probably would buy it again given the same circumstances

Reviews.Title: great picture
Reviews.Author: SSTL
Reviews.Content: picture quality is great, but the sound is ok.  the volume does not go loud enough.  if you buy plan on buying a sound bar too

Reviews.Title: Overall, great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: steven
Reviews.Content: I cannot find anything glaringly bad about this TV. The picture quality is good, its menus are easy to use, and the sound/speakers are well above average for a entry level TV.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good for the price, but does have an annoying flaw that sinks it
Reviews.Author: Dixit P.
Reviews.Content: I usually don't like to review these types of products until I've had a good while to test out the product. I've now owned this TV for over 8 months (got it in November on sale for $399) so I feel like I've experienced anything that could go possibly wrong without it being due to age.I'll just break my review down into basic pros and cons instead of some huge paragraphs.Pros:Well packaged and handledPicture quality is amazing for the priceCons:Cheap plastic stand (not a concern if you intend on wall mounting)The TV shows white "marks" when the tv is on a full black screen. It's primarily in the corners. It's not noticeable when watching anything but when you change the input and the temporary black screen is shown, I notice it easily and worry about it for those few seconds and forget againThe TV takes awhile to change channels but that could be due to it being a cheaper TV so it's understandableThe HDMI inputs are poorly placed as 3 inches below the HDMI inputs, the TV curves out so it sometimes makes it cramped to fit certain HDMI cables inThe biggest con is that the TV randomly shuts off every now and then. I read a few things on Google about this and apparently it's due to a failing power supply but my situation doesn't fit. For me, it turns off maybe 2-3 times a day with no notice. It takes like 5 seconds before it's ready to respond again to the power button. But, all those other hours it's on, it works flawlessly. The issue is annoying to say the least especially when it has happened during the Superbowl and NBA Playoff games.All in all, you can see I have way more cons that I do pros but I like anybody else notice the bad more than the good. I still use the TV everyday and don't regret getting it on that sale though if I had the money I wouldn't purchase this TV again. Overall, 2 stars is my verdict.

Reviews.Title: It's worth the Money
Reviews.Author: Steven m corwin
Reviews.Content: This TV has been well worth what I paid for it ($350).  The picture quality is slightly better than my LCD TV which this has replaced, the LCD went to the basement game room.  It doesn't have the quality of a more expensive brand, but it does provide the most bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: Great TV! Audio not so great
Reviews.Author: Steven Weis
Reviews.Content: Purchased the TV when it was on sale for 50% off so it was a great deal! Been incredibly happy with the picture quality, but the only thing that is sub-par is the audio. Regardless of how high I set the volume on the TV it never seems loud enough, and the only way to rectify it will be by buying a sound system of sorts. Other than that, I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV for the price, American Company!
Reviews.Author: H.S.
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my Mom and Dad. They love it and it is very clear. The buttons are simple. The TV itself is super thin. Everyone always notices how thin the TV is.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Derek Fosson
Reviews.Content: Good product for the price. Speakers aren't that great but overall a nice tv for the money. Yeah yeah yeah

Reviews.Title: A good TV
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for 399 couldnt pass it up, what a great deal. I have had the for 3 months now and so far the tv has great performance. There is some backlight bleed on dark scenes.

Reviews.Title: Non working VGA
Reviews.Author: Ymemon786
Reviews.Content: None working VGA poor quality and a difficult readout.....hdmi1 pulls away also has fuzzy on channel 1. So I don't really understand why new item does this

Reviews.Title: Great for the price, but that's obviously qualified praise
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Got this on Cyber Monday for $348 with free Prime shipping, and for under $350 I definitely can't complain.  That being said, one pixel is stuck and I can't get it unstuck.  To me it's not worth the hassle of exchanging it, and is a minor annoyance with which I'll have to live.  Blacks are pretty "pixelated" and don't look great, which I gather to some extent is endemic in LCD displays, so I don't have a good sense of how the blacks on the Seiki display compare to other televisions; all I know is the blacks don't look good.  Bright colors, however, look beautiful on this display.  Movement is a bit choppy, but again I don't have a good sense of whether all televisions with 60Hz refresh rates are similarly choppy or whether this one is worse than others.  Bottom line: If television were a big part of my life, I would have bought a more expensive set and been much more discriminating about the quality; but for my casual TV watching, I did want the 46-inch screen but otherwise was okay saving a few bucks and buying a model I knew might not be the best out there.

Reviews.Title: Over all a good item for the price
Reviews.Author: reza
Reviews.Content: The coax male broke after the first time use, because it the ports are not secure enough. The placement of the ports are very tight and not easy to get to.For the price can't complain. But if you want really high quality item, this is not the one for you. If you want it to show a good video and have a good audio, could be a great addition for the office or basement or kids room.Not heavy, and very easy to install.

Reviews.Title: good for the cost
Reviews.Author: L. Gray
Reviews.Content: t.v. picture is awesome... sound quality needs help...going to add some speakers or surround soundsystem...the company that shipped it...shipped ita day late...at least it was a good price....

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!!!
Reviews.Author: D0kk3n
Reviews.Content: I got this TV and have no issues! Great picture, mounts on the wall with no issues at all. I think the 5 bad reviews were due to "user" caused issues.

Reviews.Title: Love my new led television
Reviews.Author: Vivian A. Bell "In my opinion"
Reviews.Content: Wonderful price, great picture, very happy with my selection! This was a very good purchase and a great savings.  I  am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Looks great
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: If your searching for the best tv available keep going. and be prepared to spend to get it.For ~$350 this tv is amazing.Zero complaints. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV but....
Reviews.Author: Cole B.
Reviews.Content: I love this TV. The shipping was fast with prime, and instillation was very easy. I am amazed by the picture the screen has, and is comparable to Samsung and Toshiba. My only complaint is that a dead pixel appeared on the screen within one week of owning the television. I had it replaced through Amazon's replacement service, and received my new TV swiftly after talking to them. There is a dead pixel IN THE SAME SPOT! I don't know if it's just bad luck or a bad batch of screens. Is anyone else having this issue? If it wasn't for the dead pixel i would give this product five stars.

Reviews.Title: great value
Reviews.Author: William Koller
Reviews.Content: nothing went wrong in order, ship unpack, setup,view.  intuitive to use, a fine picture, can use my tv ears which is not easy on some of the newer highly rated sets, priced under similar sets so that makes it a great value

Reviews.Title: Love it!!  Very thin!!
Reviews.Author: Darlene Carroll
Reviews.Content: We are very impressed with the quality of the TV.  We were hesitant to purchase as we were not familiar with the brand, however it was a great deal on Black Friday so we gave it a whirl.  The picture is very vibrant and it is sooo thin.  We did purchase the warranty just to be sure.  So only time will tell, but so far its fabulous.My only concern was that they left the package on our front porch and it has on the outside of the package a huge picture of a TV with 46" LED on it.  So just be alert to receive your package and sign up for the text alerts.

Reviews.Title: Terrible LED bleed
Reviews.Author: Pete
Reviews.Content: I received this television as a gift from my parents. When it first arrived, I was very excited. A few days ago my wife and I decided to hook it up and test it out. When we first powered it on, I was pretty impressed. I noticed a hint of LED bleed on the upper left-hand corner of the TV, but it was tolerable. Tonight we turned it on for the second time and the LED bleed was much more noticeable and seems to have spread. Is this common with this TV or LEDs in general? It makes watching dark scenes in movies almost unwatchable as there is almost no true black to the picture.Is this normal?

Reviews.Title: Good TV with Bad Sound
Reviews.Author: Wrigley
Reviews.Content: It's a good basic TV without many frills, but you'll want a good sound system to plug it into.  Very happy with the size and slim design.

Reviews.Title: VERY GOOD TV FOR THE PRICE
Reviews.Author: Weston Martin
Reviews.Content: This tv is pretty awsome it has a very good size screen picture is very clear.  the tv is super thin yet has a very durable feel to it.  great tv for the price in my opinion

Reviews.Title: Seiki 46" 1080 LED TV
Reviews.Author: bseale
Reviews.Content: Ordered this TV from Tiger Direct on 11/23 as it was $429 with a $100 mail in re bait and free s hipping. received it 11/29  Set it up last night and was very surprised!  installation was fast and easy.  Picture is great and for $329  cant be beat (as long as I get my re bait)  The only negatives are as others have said the sound seems to have 4 levels, Mute low med high but I expected this from other reviewers and as this is for my bedroom it is fine.  If this lats for 3 years I will be pleased as punch and will update if there are any issues.  Also, if any of you find dead pixels or lines, google massaging dead pixels to try and fix.  I had 3 pixels that were showing but with a light touch all went back to normal, probably from being out in the cold during delivery.

Reviews.Title: My first flat screen tv
Reviews.Author: High Peaks "goldwest"
Reviews.Content: I upgraded from a big, fat 10 year old, not HD, Sharp tv. I have nothing to compare it with, but I love it so far. The sound while watching a dvd was poor, but for regular tv, its great. Like I said, this is a big upgrade for me, so maybe it doesn't take much to make me happy! I think 10 years ago, I paid 600.00 for the Sharp at Wally world, so it's sure worth the price. I've been waiting for one to come along that I could afford, and this fits the bill as far as I'm concerned.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: M. Marrott
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant about the tv at first because it was not a popular brand name. I took a chance for the amazing price and ordered it. Got it, set it up, and not a problem so far. Excellent picture quality, great color and contrast. It is extremely thin and light for the size. I would definitely recommend this if budget is an issue. I will update if there are any issues.Update: Overall I am still impressed with the tv, however there are a few issues that are annoying, but not enough to return it. There is a little bit of LED bleeding on the left side of the screen, and some in the corners. This is visible unless viewed on an entirely black screen and does not interfere with the picture when viewing anything but an all black screen. The sound quality is not very good. I would recommend buying a sound bar or other alternative like a surround sound system instead.All in all I am still very pleased with the television and would recommend it to anyone who is on a tight budget. My 5 star recommendation still stands.

Reviews.Title: Great LED for the Price Point
Reviews.Author: Yokota
Reviews.Content: Great secondary TV for a Master Bedroom let me start by saying that I also own a 60 inch Sharp Aquos LED for comparison.  I was skeptical at first but for 348 and free shipping I figured I would give it a try and send it back if I was unimpressed. I received the TV yesterday and had pretty low expectations for this off brand LED. I have to say that my assumptions were proven wrong fairly quickly. The 60hz refresh rate is a little slow and I could notice the difference when watching a basketball game compared to my Sharp, but not enough to justify the price difference. I will say that you are considering buying this for gaming or sports I would look elsewhere since the refresh rate and response time are lacking on this T.V., but if you simply want a large LED for the Master Bedroom or Playroom then this is a great deal, especially when you consider a 4 year warranty is less than 50 bucks. The colors on this set are not as vivid or deep as my Sharp but better than my old 32 inch JVC LCD that this TV replaced. I have this hooked up to a Direct TV HD box and it looks good, not amazing, but nice for the price range. I can't put enough emphasis on not getting this TV and expecting Samsung quality, it's simply not possible in this price range.  The only thing that I didn't like about the transaction is that the TV was delivered in the original box, so if you live in an Apartment leave a note to leave this at the front, otherwise hope you have honest neighbors.All-in-all I would say that this TV is a great buy at less than 350 for a 46 inch LED; I would suggest this TV for anyone looking for a nice secondary TV.  The manufacture site offers the remote codes to all major cable and satellite networks for the remote.Although it is an off brand it's a Japanese off brand, not Chinese. There a huge difference there.[...]

Reviews.Title: So far, a terrible experience.
Reviews.Author: Jesse D. Walker
Reviews.Content: Consider this an "in progress" review.I received the television today, and am attempting to set it up. I'm failing miserably, and I don't think it's my fault. The television powers on, the colors seem fine, I can get things to display... but the horizontal and vertical settings are way off. Regardless of input source (I've tried a blu-ray player and a computer), I can't get the full display to show on the television. It stretches off the viewable area in an annoying way. Adjusting zoom settings doesn't help. According to the not-so-adequate manual that came with the television, there are adjustment options in the setup menu specifically for this. Under the 'advanced' tab. Which I can see in the menu. But it's grayed out and inaccessible. While selecting things with the arrow keys, that option gets skipped right over, as do several other options within the menu.At first I thought I was in "retail" mode (rather than "home" mode), since I didn't get the setup wizard I was supposed to when I first turned on the television. But I've accessed that finally (after a factory reset), but to no avail. I even found the secret service menu, did a genuine factory service reset, and that didn't help either. Nor did Initializing the EEPROM (another service option), which is yet another way to get a genuine reset. The control to fix the problem I'm experiencing is still inaccessible.Anyway, this is frustrating. I'll need to call the company and see what they say. After that, I'll update this review. In the meantime, I'd strongly suggest avoiding this television. I love my Vizio. Never had an issue with it, and setup was a breeze. The manual was significantly better as well.**Edit#1: Nothing positive to add yet, but I've watched a couple episodes of Star Trek:Voyager on the TV thanks to Amazon's excellent prime video service, and the "image persistence" on this television is horrible. Any dark scene shows leftover image remnants from the past 10 seconds or so worth of light and dark spots. The remnant images go away eventually, only to be replaced by new ones. They're most visible in any dark scene, and especially obvious when it goes to a black screen. I can't imagine other televisions are this bad, I never saw anything similar on my prior/other television. I have a new appreciation for my Vizio.

Reviews.Title: great picture!
Reviews.Author: somrtoy
Reviews.Content: nothing better on the market (for the price) to this day!!!!!! compares with my bigger samsung for pic quality.... amazing

Reviews.Title: Flat Screen
Reviews.Author: Debra Gagnon
Reviews.Content: The tv works very well.  No problem at all with it.  We got it for a second tv and are pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: Overall pleased
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The TV is a very good product for the price. Clear picture , the sound could be a little improved.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Ned B Crofts
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV over a year ago for Christmas.  I was a little worried because I had never heard of the brand.  So far it has performed well.  My wife and kids have it turned on for most of the day, nearly every day.  It has a sharp picture and great color.  It is plenty bright.  After about 9 months, there was a thin foam strip that began to sag out onto the screen.  I used scissors to cut about 10 inches out of it and there has not been a problem since.  We bought a "smart" bluray player to hook up to the TV so no need to have a "smart" tv.We got a good deal on a great TV.  I would recommend this product to anyone

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: John P. ODonnell
Reviews.Content: I needed a new television and after researching this model found that it was rated well and had a price under $500 for an LED model. I have been using it for over a year now and am very pleased.

Reviews.Title: not very reliable
Reviews.Author: James N.
Reviews.Content: My tv lost sound today, new years eve. I paid for the extended warranty and was reimbursed for the price I originally paid. I bought it on cyber monday in 2012 so the reimbursement won't replace the tv. I would have expected to get more than fourteen months out of this.  Make sure you get a warranty.

Reviews.Title: Cheap is ok
Reviews.Author: Rease
Reviews.Content: ProsIt's bigIt's HDIt worksIt has ports a plentyNo dead pixelsConsMount was a little difficult and doesn't spinAt first it's choppy with Xbox I don't notice any more with my PC on itNot of the highest quality, you notice it's not like a sony or samsung if you switch up tvsI wouldn't have bought this if it was over 400 when I did. It was and impulse buy on cyber Monday for me. I suggest getting a smaller better brand because Bigger isn't better. But I'm stuck with it and it's ok. it has worked for a year and will continue to work into the future.

Reviews.Title: Seiki Customer Service / Warranty product replacement a joke
Reviews.Author: Tina LaFlam
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Seiki TV through Amazon in November 2012 , it has worked fine until 3 weeks ago it just no longer gets power, I have tried everything, my old tv works but this one does not. I have since been trying to return it as per the manufacturer (Seiki) warranty which it is still under. However, it has been impossible to reach a person I get nothing but recorded messages and put on hold for over an hour at times I try several times daily with no luck I have even emailed to no avail, just today I also filed a complaint with the BBB as it is very frustrating to not be able to reach someone in regards to fixing or replacing my tv that I spent good money on.  If this is how Seiki operates I would not buy from them again and I feel Amazon should also be aware.

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: heath
Reviews.Content: Use this tv as my main tv in the living room and very happy with the picture quality.  You get a lot for what the price of tv is

Reviews.Title: amazing deal, still looks and sounds awesome
Reviews.Author: Shariq Haque
Reviews.Content: for what i paid for it this TV is amazing.  Setup was great and after about a year of ownership everything is working as it should.

Reviews.Title: Seiki 46" is a great bargain
Reviews.Author: Rob Daivs
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV yesterday and we're very satisfied. I've never heard of the brand before and that used to be a deal killer for me when it came to electronics. These days however, TV's especially don't last as long as they used to so brand name isn't as important to me anymore. I've had LCD, plasma and LED TVs made by very well known and reputable brands that just don't last as long as those "old school" tube TV's used to. This particular TV replaced one of those "old school" tube TV's that's 12 years old and still works great, but I can't change the aspect ratio on it so sports scores during a game are almost all out of frame. Kinda frustrating.I was looking for a 42" in the $400 range and came across this TV in a local big box store ad. After reading the reviews on Amazon, I decided to take a chance and go for the bigger 46". I got mine for around $380.After unpacking, I read the instructions which cover everything, but you can tell is from a lower brand manufacturer. There's also a decent and easy to understand start-up guide.I like that there are multiple inputs for this TV. That's something often overlooked by most people but is a big let down when you get it home and can't plug in all your goodies. This one has 3 HDMI inputs, component inputs as well as RCA inputs and others.I agree with other reviewers that the base for this TV is a little on the weak/wobbly side. In my case this won't be an issue because its in a corner where kids wont be running around. If yours will be in an open area where it could be bumped into, this could pose a problem. A wall mount would be a good way to remedy this.The sound, as others have mentioned, is not home theater quality by any means, but as a bedroom TV it's adequate. I might upgrade in the future with a small sound bar or surround speakers.The picture is fantastic and couldn't be more pleased. I'm running my High Def cable box and PS3  both through HDMI's and the picture is amazing!I hope to re-review this TV in 8-10 months to give my long term assessment, but upon initial impression, I am pleased.I bought this TV for a few reasons...The first was the overall strong reviews on Amazon, the second was the great price. I read the negative reviews and saw that those who had problems were met with not so great customer service from Seiki, however, if you read the comments to those bad reviews someone from Seiki has included a direct email address to help remedy any issues...so it seems to me they are trying. I personally hope I never have to go down that road in the future, but we'll see.All in all I give this TV a solid four stars and for the price I got it at, that bumps it up to five!

Reviews.Title: Best TV we've got!
Reviews.Author: Cr8zy for Wickless "LCattell.Scentsy.us"
Reviews.Content: We bought this one Black Friday after we waited in line several hours for several TV's in the store. Once we didn't get them we decided to go home and look online. I ran across this and snatched it up quickly. It is AWESOME! We had never heard of this brand before buying it but thought with the specifications of it, we would give it a shot for the price. It's been GREAT 10 months later! It's picture quality is perfect. We don't use the sound on it as ours goes through our surround sound so can't comment on that aspect. But I am seeing this brand all over now and it's a GREAT TV. I would definitely buy this brand and TV again!

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Bo
Reviews.Content: This is the nicest T V I ever had.  A little trouble with volume but I guess this should be expected for such a low price.  We just keep it all the way up and most of the time this is ok.

Reviews.Title: quality ok
Reviews.Author: nicole
Reviews.Content: This tv had to grow on me. I hated it when I first bought it because of the picture quality. It was grainy, but after tweaking a few things it was better. I like it now because when you use HD the picture quality gets MUCH better. I don't think I would purchase it again if given the opportunity, I'd just pay more for a better tv. I have flat-screen Sony in my room and that quality is great with or without HD.  But this tv seems to have  improved over time and the picture looks much better so I'm okay with it now.

Reviews.Title: SE461TS
Reviews.Author: Casper
Reviews.Content: Was delivered with only 1/2 of the screen working. Could not finish the initial set up. Give Amazon 5 stars for getting it replaced. Give Seiki 3 stars for quality control. Maybe it should have been lower.

Reviews.Title: Unknown brand, but great for the price!
Reviews.Author: Anya
Reviews.Content: This TV is doing an excellent job so far. Definitely a steal for the price! I would definitely recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Unbeatable value
Reviews.Author: Doug X
Reviews.Content: I picked this TV up on sale for $350 shipped, and I think that's pretty unbeatable.  I'm using it as a gigantic computer monitor and it does the job perfectly.  No dead pixels, great sharpness, good backlight, great viewing angle.I'm using it as a multitouch table, and it has worked very well so far.  I put a 46" multitouch frame on it and built an enclosure for it so that it can lay flat and you can put chairs around it.  I have a computer hooked up to it via the DSUB connector, and the resolution is 1920x1080.  It's big enough for six player games.  It looks great and has a good viewing angle, even for a horizontal application like mine.

Reviews.Title: SEIKI SE 461TS
Reviews.Author: LM
Reviews.Content: We used to have a Sony Bravia KDL-46W4100 that we had for almost 3 yrs before it started going bad. My son finally finished it off with an accident so we went out and found the SEIKI SE461TS. We were really surprised with its amazing low price. We got the set for $379.00 so with taxes it came out to be $410.00 . This is only our 2nd day with the set and it had a very easy setup. The channel reception is fantastic. I believe this set looks better than our Sony every looked. It is much more crisp.  I attribute most of it to be LED vs LCD for the SONY. It picks up the over the air channels much better than the SONY ever did.  For the money this TV is well worth it. We watched some movies on the DVD with it and it worked fine with it. Overall I think it is a very nice bare bones model TV. We are satisfied with our purchase at this point.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Rene Hinson
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price. $350 got it for black Friday price. Sound need tweeking but other than that 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: great tv for a great price
Reviews.Author: d
Reviews.Content: been using this tv for a couple of months now. Excellent hd picture quality and good sound quality, fills the room. I have this on a table using the included stand - may wall mount it in the future. The included stand does make me a little nervous, it seems a bit wobbly to the touch but seems to be holding the tv ok. I would keep an eye on small children around it though.It took me a while to program my cable remote, as Seiki was not a brand listed with the codes, but after calling a few stores I was told that this brand is made by Samsung, and to try using the Samsung codes - and I found one that worked! Yay, cable remote works!One thing that took getting used to, the tv takes a while to power on. When you hit the power button, it stays black for a moment, then lights up blue, then flashes the Seiki logo for a couple of seconds before fully turning on. Maybe a prob for those who need instant gratification? Not a big deal, just thought I'd mention. Works great once it's on.

Reviews.Title: very good product for a great price
Reviews.Author: Walter
Reviews.Content: I got this TV right after Cyber Monday, for $340. Such a good deal! The TV works great and the quality is very good.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding value!
Reviews.Author: Paul G. McCravy
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 46 inch Seiki LED from a chain store for $397 and what a good deal it turned out to be. Big box stores do not spend much time tweaking the picture of their "loss leaders" so I wasn't discouraged by the washed out picture of the display model or the salesman efforts to steer me to a higher priced LED. Once I got the Seiki home and gave it a good signal from the TW high def box and made a few easy meezy adjustments I had a stellar picture that popped with vibrant color.The menu is so easy to use that anyone can tweak the picture settings in a matter of seconds. Paying big bucks for picture calibration is bull manure and buying the extended warranty takes the Seiki out of the bargain basement category. My relative who works in the industry says, "if panels fail it's generally out of the box or within the first year and your factory warranty covers that".As others have noted, while the picture is excellent the sound is just passable. The small speakers located on the rear of the enclosure are no doubt the reason for the this. I solved this problem by connecting some spare PC speakers ( Logitech Z-2300 ) which have very good sound and include a small subwoofer.I have the Seiki in a bedroom and it's the perfect size for my medium sized room. It's picture quality rivals the 55" Panasonic 3D plasma in my main viewing area.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: mapdit
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV for a great deal last year. Íve been using it for my bed room and so far I love it very much. I used it a lots last week to learn about the series of Boston Marathon Bombing events.

Reviews.Title: Very glad I purchased this!
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this TV. I was skeptical at first because for the most part the saying goes "you get what you pay for". This TV replaced my 40 inch Samsung TV and I'm so happy I made that decision. This TV is very thin and LED. You can't pass it up for the price and if you're on edge on whether you want to get it or not, just get it you won't be let down! The negative reviews I read on this were that the TV was delivered damaged but that was not the case for me at all. Fast shipping and I came home from school and there it was leaned up against my garage. We'll see how long it lasts but I'd assume it'll last just as long as any other TV.EDIT: I also purchased this back in November 2012 and the price was $348 with free shipping. I see the price has gone up.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Harrison White
Reviews.Content: wonderful so far. This tv servies its purpose. Clean views and sharp pictures. the sound is descent  though I recommend a sound bar.

Reviews.Title: I could not have asked for more and would have settled for less
Reviews.Author: C. R. Love
Reviews.Content: This TV is fantastic. The colors are bright and vibrant and the blacks are really black, something that makes all the difference in picture quality.The stand is about as flimsy as a sheet of paper, but the TV has not toppled to the floor in the month I've owned it and I'm sure that it won't.If I hear of someone needing a new TV I would recommend this one.UPDATE: I've had the TV for about 5 months now and the stand is still holding it up.

Reviews.Title: Present
Reviews.Author: Mary Martin
Reviews.Content: Was a present for my parents for Christmas.  They were very pleased.  Not sure how it is working because I haven't seen it in their house yet.

Reviews.Title: AAA
Reviews.Author: Norman
Reviews.Content: AAA+++ The past is the past, the future is the future!! Nine more words and I can submit this review!

Reviews.Title: Meets my expectations and more
Reviews.Author: Wendell Demby
Reviews.Content: The pictures are great. The sound is okay. I have to put the volume at least miday to get the full effect. Overall I am very pleased for the price I paid for it. Money well spent.

Reviews.Title: Fast shipping, and a great TV!
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my daughter's room. I was worried that it might not work well or look good, but I was pleasantly surprised. We even play games on it and it looks great! The price was unbeatable and I have recommended this same TV to several people.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Tenacious T
Reviews.Content: I've had my tv for a week now and absolutely love it. I recommend hooking Apple TV up to it as for some reason, it seems to give the clearest display. It's crystal clear from the appropriate distance. This is quite necessary to mention though. Sitting within five feet of this TV will make it appear blurry and probably hurt your eyes.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: paintkarz
Reviews.Content: Easy to assemble, ready to go out of the box. Great picture at a great price. Works perfect in my bedroom. The picture is just as good as more expensive models.

Reviews.Title: fine television, bad Dish rebate
Reviews.Author: Charles R. Evans
Reviews.Content: This television for the price I paid {$350} is a good buy. The screen is reflective, so if your room has a window directly facing the tv I wouldn't recommend it. The sound is a little thin, but for thin screen LED tv's, about par for the course. For $250,which wouuld have been its net cost to me with the $100 rebate from Dish it would have been a great buy.  It was initially scheduled to arrive 5 weeks after my Dish installation, within the first week of January. Didn"t arrive. Called Dish and they couldn't find that I was elegible. Called Amazon and while they did offer me a much lesser credit they said there was nothing they could do about The problem. Called Dish back and they found the credit and said it would be another 4-5 weeks before I got it. Now its March 10. I ordered this tv November 27, and I have yet to get my rebate. I notice this rebate is available with lots of tv purchases on Amazon. All I can say is don't count on receiving it. Why Amazon associates itself with a program that has such terrible customer service I have no idea.

Reviews.Title: Clear picture
Reviews.Author: Brenda monies
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a Christmas gift for my daughter and her husband. She said it was one of the most clear pictures she has ever seen. Good quality and she's lovin it!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great picture, terrible sound
Reviews.Author: A Real Guy "I'm realer than you!"
Reviews.Content: This TV is a great value.  I've had it for about 4 months now and I still love it.  You can't beat the price (I got it on a cyber monday).  The only complaint I have is that the sound is so terrible.  I know speakers are the first thing they use to cut costs, but this is terrible. I had to get a sound bar to handle sound, which works out great- still a great deal even after having to pay for the sound bar.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Sammy
Reviews.Content: Beautiful crystal clear Picture, Arrived on time!Watched the Big game with my friends and they couldn't believe the cheap price i Paid!

Reviews.Title: GREAT GREAT GREAT
Reviews.Author: Patricia Dominguez G "dominguez"
Reviews.Content: I have this hooked up to a dtv antennaand the picture is great!  Clear clear clear! It is VERY SLIMcaution for those who have small children or pets, because of the slimnessthe tv does have more movement than a standard weight tv.I would recommend buying the wall mount or a wall re-inforcer.Can't beat this price!

Reviews.Title: A Great Tv!
Reviews.Author: Tyler Sharp
Reviews.Content: This tv is amazing! Here's a short list to some pros and cons.Pros:1.) Quality is amazing!!!!2.)3 HDMI Ports3.) The Edges of the TV make it look good. It looks like some type of brushed aluminum.4.)Very sleekCons:1.) The TV is lit from the corners. Once theres a complete black screen youll notice this.2.) Picture is in not very noticable blocks3.) Speakers aren't great4.) you can tell its a 60 Hz Tv when watching a movie or playing a First Person Shooter.Overall: Buy this over any name brand. You wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: Not that great!!
Reviews.Author: LJS
Reviews.Content: Not that great! This TV was purchased as a Christmas gift. White spots began developing in the display about three weeks after set up. I believe that it will need to be replaced.

Reviews.Title: Awesome picture quality
Reviews.Author: Paul B
Reviews.Content: I got this TV a little late but that didn't affect the quality of the TV. I was a little skeptical at first because I had never heard of Seiki before, but once I mounted it and played some Blu-rays on it, it has spectacular image quality and would recommend to anyone if they don't care for a smart TV. Get and Apple TV and Roku box instead. They have better interfaces anyways.And as always, get a separate sound system

Reviews.Title: Good as any other TV
Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: I bought this on Black Friday 2012, haven't had any problems yet. Everyone always talks about the bigger brand TV companies but they are just brainwashed by commercials. There are only five major television factories in the world, so they are all made in the same place. This TV works fine, no problems.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Normal Guy
Reviews.Content: The picture isn't very clear, regardless of how you adjust the settings.  The stand that supports it is very flimsy, I feel like the tv is one gust of wind from falling over. The biggest thing that irks me is the A/V inputs on the tv. After a month they completely stopped working. Therefore, I can only use the HDMI inputs on the tv or I'm screwed (I'm sure those will go out soon too). I understand that this tv was going to fall short when compared to a more expensive model, however I did not expect a cheap piece of junk that would have defects within a month. Buyer Beware, don't purchase.

Reviews.Title: Incredible price.
Reviews.Author: Randy Wilson
Reviews.Content: Got this tv for $350 INCLUDING freight AND I got it the NEXT day. Propped that baby up and plan on watching the Superbowl on it.

Reviews.Title: Great T.V. for the price.
Reviews.Author: Mark Vazquez
Reviews.Content: Bought the TV before christmas and it was delivered 3 days faster than quoted. All parts were in the box and the TV was in great shape. This TV isn't the flashiest unit on the block but does what is advertised. Movies look great and so do video games. The only downside is the sound but if you add a soundbar or a surround system the TV is a winner. Very happy with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: I love my TV
Reviews.Author: Sugar454
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this to anyone.  Great picture.  Only thing I am not that impressed with is the sound.  It seems like after half way on the volume it doesn't really get any louder!  That is the only down side to this TV.  Bright & clear.  It is a brand I haven't heard of but it is as good as the big name manufacturers.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: DEFA MUSLEH
Reviews.Content: great tv!!! the tv shipped as soon as i paid, and i recieved it way before i expected it to arrive.

Reviews.Title: Great Deal - But went Back
Reviews.Author: Ronald Wurst
Reviews.Content: This was a Black Friday deal.  The price was great, delivery very prompt and the TV looked fine.  After using it for a while occasionally the TV would not respond to any commands.  Initially we thought the batteries in the remote were bad, then we discovered it wouldn't respond to the controls on the frame.We called Seiki thinking there was a trick, but they said send it back to the retailer.  I was once again impressed with Amazon, they had an UPS man at my door the next day, and my credit whithin a week,

Reviews.Title: Seiki 46 inch slim
Reviews.Author: Mat
Reviews.Content: I paid right around $400 for the Seiki SE461TS 46-Inch 1080p 60Hz Slim LED HDTV and so far I am very happy with my purchase.Pros:Great pictureEasy Setup3 hdmi ports (cable and ps3 use 2 of them and have a 3rd for anything else I want to plug in)Relatively light for the size and I can easily move it myselfThe priceI love how thin it isCons:Poor speaker qualityThe speakers aren't great but my tv is hooked up to my surround so I don't notice it.  For the price I was not expected a flawless tv and I am glad it was speaker sound quality and no something I could fix.  I wish the base of the tv would rotate but other than that I am a fan of the tv.

Reviews.Title: BEST TV EVER!!!
Reviews.Author: janet
Reviews.Content: MY FRIEND CALLED ME ON THANKSGIVING DAY AND TOLD ME THAT I NEED TO ORDER THIS TV RIGHT THEN ON AMAZON FOR $349.99.  SINCE I VALUE HIS OPINION, I DID EVEN THOUGH I ALREADY HAD A 32".  WELL, LET ME TELL YOU, THIS TV IS AMAZING!!!  MY FRIEND MOUNTED IT TO THE WALL WITH SURROUND SOUND AND NOW I WATCH TV WITH ANY FREE TIME! THE TV ARRIVED AT MY DOOR BY FED EX IN 2 DAYS.  HE EVEN BROUGHT IT IN TO MY HOUSE FOR ME. AND OF COURSE WITH AMAZON THERE IS NO SHIPPING CHARGES OR TAXES.  I FOR SURE DID NOT GO WRONG WITH THIS PURCHASE!!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Ullrich
Reviews.Content: This TV purchased as replacement for Samsung 42" plasma that gave up the ghost. This Seiki has an immensely better picture. The blacks are truly black, with none of the typical HD camo patterns seen on most TV's. The picture is vivid, lots of color depth and very bright. It's also very light, weight-wise, and is a nice looking cabinet. I would definitely recommend this TV to any of my friends/family.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a great price
Reviews.Author: Bryan Dean
Reviews.Content: I took a risk on this TV and I'm glad I did. The image quality is slightly less than higher end LED televisions, but at 1/3 of the price, it's still very good. I have my PC attached to it with XBMC streaming from an HTPC and 1080p looks fantastic. SD cable looks much less fantastic. My only annoyance with this television is the 5-10 second bootup time. But to save $500, I can live with that. :-D

Reviews.Title: TV Purchase
Reviews.Author: Thomas Jemielita
Reviews.Content: The TV arrived fairly quickly and was in good condition. So far, the TV has been great and I would recommend this TV to anyone looking for a cheaper TV with a huge screen.

Reviews.Title: GREAT DEAL
Reviews.Author: KARI
Reviews.Content: THIS WAS A GREAT DEAL FOR THE $$. IT HAS A REALLY  GOOD PICTURE. IT WAS  EASY TO CONNECT AND ASSEMBLE.

Reviews.Title: good value
Reviews.Author: Cady Lady "cookbook lover"
Reviews.Content: Set up was easy, good picture quality, fits our lives perfectly.  The sound system isn't very good, but we always hook our TVs to the stereo system we have so it is no problem. The price was definitely the best part. Most TVs of this size are hundreds of dollars more. I loved having it delivered to our house since we have no big car or truck to purchase a large item like this at a store and haul it home. The stores offer delivery, but at an extra $50.00 charge. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Anthony Brown
Reviews.Content: First shipping was perfect arrived in 2 days no problems, packaging was exceptional. The television is probably one of the lightest 46" sets I have seen. Setup was easy took all of 5 minutes, the base is a little flimsy could have been designed better. The picture is crystal clear and the remote is simple to operate.

Reviews.Title: Broke in 1 week!
Reviews.Author: Michael J Casey
Reviews.Content: I bought this for a great price and when I received it, it looked great. After less than a week of normal use, a huge black area began to develop out of the top corner almost down to the center of the screen, making the TV useless. I returned this item for a refund...DO NOT BUY!!!

Reviews.Title: Not very good
Reviews.Author: Aliceinwonderland
Reviews.Content: The picture is not very clear and the sound is not good.  Very low volume and at time sounds muffled.

Reviews.Title: Super Nice TV for the Price
Reviews.Author: S. Rogers
Reviews.Content: The picture is clear. For the price, this TV is a great bargain. I would higly recommend it. Great dea!!

Reviews.Title: excellent quality and price
Reviews.Author: Ryan Sosamon
Reviews.Content: This TV was definitely up to my expectations.  I bought it for a man cave, and the picture quality is amazing!

Reviews.Title: It's a good deal… but not a good tv.
Reviews.Author: J. L. Birrueta "Ever Bothersome"
Reviews.Content: My opinion, simple. This tv is very inexpensive, so I considered it. It is a 1080p 60hz tv with plenty of inputs (i.e., 3 HDMI; 1VGA; 1USB; 1 Component/Composite combo, more on this later; 1COAX; and 1RCA output, the red and white cables for sound).As far as picture goes, this tv looks great. That darks look nice and black, and the brights don't overlap.My problem lies upon to aspects of this tv, and, of course, this may bother any possible future buyers. On the description for the product it says that the product as 1 Component, and 1 Composite inputs respectably. However, this tv has a combo of the two, meaning that it has the yellow input for composite, but if you want to use the red and white for sound you have to unplug that for the Component, meaning you can only use one at a time. They two inputs were falsely advertised as being two individual inputs, which inconvenienced me.The other problem I had with this product is the sound. I have a set of M Audio 40 speakers (it'll matter in a second). The speakers on a tv can never be expected to sound vull and bassy or anything, but they are expected not to crackle as if they're turned up all the way when they're not even half way the max. These speakers sounded horrible; everything crackled, at any volume level. Now, remember those speakers I mentioned? Lol. They matter now. I figured that it shouldn't matter if the tv doesn't sound too good since I won't be using it's default speaker since I have my external ones. So, I plugged in the M Audio speakers and they crackled as well, which I worried could damage them.
